001// Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors.
002// Open Source Software; you can modify and/or share it under the terms of

004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.event;
006
007import static edu.wpi.first.util.ErrorMessages.requireNonNullParam;
008
009import edu.wpi.first.math.filter.Debouncer;
010import java.util.function.BiFunction;
011import java.util.function.BooleanSupplier;
012
013/**
014 * This class provides an easy way to link actions to high-active logic signals. Each object
015 * represents a digital signal to which callback actions can be bound using {@link
016 * #ifHigh(Runnable)}.
017 *
018 * <p>These signals can easily be composed for advanced functionality using {@link
019 * #and(BooleanSupplier)}, {@link #or(BooleanSupplier)}, {@link #negate()} etc.
020 *
021 * <p>To get an event that activates only when this one changes, see {@link #falling()} and {@link
022 * #rising()}.
023 */
024public class BooleanEvent implements BooleanSupplier {
025  /** Poller loop. */
026  protected final EventLoop m_loop;
027  /** Condition. */
028  private final BooleanSupplier m_signal;
029
030  /**
031   * Creates a new event with the given signal determining whether it is active.
032   *
033   * @param loop the loop that polls this event
034   * @param signal the digital signal represented by this object.
035   */
036  public BooleanEvent(EventLoop loop, BooleanSupplier signal) {
037    m_loop = requireNonNullParam(loop, "loop", "BooleanEvent");
038    m_signal = requireNonNullParam(signal, "signal", "BooleanEvent");
039  }
040
041  /**
042   * Check the state of this signal (high or low).
043   *
044   * @return true for the high state, false for the low state.
045   */
046  @Override
047  public final boolean getAsBoolean() {
048    return m_signal.getAsBoolean();
049  }
050
051  /**
052   * Bind an action to this event.
053   *
054   * @param action the action to run if this event is active.
055   */
056  public final void ifHigh(Runnable action) {
057    m_loop.bind(m_signal, action);
058  }
059
060  /**
061   * Get a new event that events only when this one newly changes to true.
062   *
063   * @return a new event representing when this one newly changes to true.
064   */
065  public BooleanEvent rising() {
066    return new BooleanEvent(
067        m_loop,
068        new BooleanSupplier() {
069          private boolean m_previous = m_signal.getAsBoolean();
070
071          @Override
072          public boolean getAsBoolean() {
073            boolean present = m_signal.getAsBoolean();
074            boolean ret = !m_previous && present;
075            m_previous = present;
076            return ret;
077          }
078        });
079  }
080
081  /**
082   * Get a new event that triggers only when this one newly changes to false.
083   *
084   * @return a new event representing when this one newly changes to false.
085   */
086  public BooleanEvent falling() {
087    return new BooleanEvent(
088        m_loop,
089        new BooleanSupplier() {
090          private boolean m_previous = m_signal.getAsBoolean();
091
092          @Override
093          public boolean getAsBoolean() {
094            boolean present = m_signal.getAsBoolean();
095            boolean ret = m_previous && !present;
096            m_previous = present;
097            return ret;
098          }
099        });
100  }
101
102  /**
103   * Creates a new debounced event from this event - it will become active when this event has been
104   * active for longer than the specified period.
105   *
106   * @param seconds The debounce period.
107   * @return The debounced event (rising edges debounced only)
108   */
109  public BooleanEvent debounce(double seconds) {
110    return debounce(seconds, Debouncer.DebounceType.kRising);
111  }
112
113  /**
114   * Creates a new debounced event from this event - it will become active when this event has been
115   * active for longer than the specified period.
116   *
117   * @param seconds The debounce period.
118   * @param type The debounce type.
119   * @return The debounced event.
120   */
121  public BooleanEvent debounce(double seconds, Debouncer.DebounceType type) {
122    return new BooleanEvent(
123        m_loop,
124        new BooleanSupplier() {
125          private final Debouncer m_debouncer = new Debouncer(seconds, type);
126
127          @Override
128          public boolean getAsBoolean() {
129            return m_debouncer.calculate(m_signal.getAsBoolean());
130          }
131        });
132  }
133
134  /**
135   * Creates a new event that is active when this event is inactive, i.e. that acts as the negation
136   * of this event.
137   *
138   * @return the negated event
139   */
140  public BooleanEvent negate() {
141    return new BooleanEvent(m_loop, () -> !m_signal.getAsBoolean());
142  }
143
144  /**
145   * Composes this event with another event, returning a new signal that is in the high state when
146   * both signals are in the high state.
147   *
148   * <p>The new event will use this event's polling loop.
149   *
150   * @param other the event to compose with
151   * @return the event that is active when both events are active
152   */
153  public BooleanEvent and(BooleanSupplier other) {
154    requireNonNullParam(other, "other", "and");
155    return new BooleanEvent(m_loop, () -> m_signal.getAsBoolean() && other.getAsBoolean());
156  }
157
158  /**
159   * Composes this event with another event, returning a new signal that is high when either signal
160   * is high.
161   *
162   * <p>The new event will use this event's polling loop.
163   *
164   * @param other the event to compose with
165   * @return a signal that is high when either signal is high.
166   */
167  public BooleanEvent or(BooleanSupplier other) {
168    requireNonNullParam(other, "other", "or");
169    return new BooleanEvent(m_loop, () -> m_signal.getAsBoolean() || other.getAsBoolean());
170  }
171
172  /**
173   * A method to "downcast" a BooleanEvent instance to a subclass (for example, to a command-based
174   * version of this class).
175   *
176   * @param ctor a method reference to the constructor of the subclass that accepts the loop as the
177   *     first parameter and the condition/signal as the second.
178   * @param <T> the subclass type
179   * @return an instance of the subclass.
180   */
181  public <T extends BooleanEvent> T castTo(BiFunction<EventLoop, BooleanSupplier, T> ctor) {
182    return ctor.apply(m_loop, m_signal);
183  }
184}
